info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 8:23PM CDT until May 06 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR COMANCHE...SOUTHWESTERN GRADY...SOUTHWESTERN CADDO...NORTHWESTERN STEPHENS AND EASTERN KIOWA COUNTIES... At 823 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over northwestern Fort Sill, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lawton, Cache, Elgin, Apache, Fletcher, Sterling, Medicine Park, Meers, Lake Lawtonka, Boone, Fort Sill, Lake Ellsworth, Central High, and Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
